a.g: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
And the winds that blow violently
And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
And those [angels] who bring criterion
And those [angels] who deliver a message
As justification or warning,
Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
So when the stars are obliterated
And when the heaven is opened
And when the mountains are blown away
And when the messengers' time has come...
For what Day was it postponed?
For the Day of Judgement.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not destroy the former peoples?
Then We will follow them with the later ones.
Thus do We deal with the criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?

Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And he has in his journey to perfection stages and phases from a drop of fluid (Nutfah) and a clinging clot (Alaqah) and a chewed lump (Mudghah) and others until he emerges from the narrowness of the womb to the expanse of the world. So the proportion of the general Major Resurrection (Qiyamah al-Kubra) to the specific Minor Resurrection (Qiyamah al-Sughra) is like the proportion of the expanse of the world to the expanse of the womb. And the proportion of the expanse of the world that the servant (Abd) approaches with death to the expanse of the worldly life (Dunya) is like the proportion of the expanse of the worldly life also to the womb, but wider and greater. So compare the Hereafter (Akhirah) with the first, for He did not create you nor resurrect you except as a single soul (Nafs), and the second creation (Nash'ah) is only according to the measure of the first creation. Rather, the numbers of creations are not limited to two, and to this is the allusion in His saying, the Exalted: 'And We will create you in what you do not know.' So the one who acknowledges the two Resurrections is a believer in the world of the unseen (Ghayb) and the witnessed (Shahadah) and certain of the dominion (Mulk) and the sovereignty (Malakut). And the one who acknowledges the Minor Resurrection without the Major is looking with the one-eyed eye to one of the two worlds, and that is ignorance (Jahl) and misguidance (Dhalal) and following the one-eyed Dajjal. So how great is your heedlessness, O wretched one, and all of us are that wretched one, and before you are these terrors. If you do not believe in the Major Resurrection due to ignorance and misguidance, does not the indication of the Minor Resurrection suffice you, or have you not heard the saying of the master of the prophets: 'Sufficient is death as a warner,' or have you not heard Bakr, upon him be peace, at death until he said: 'O Allah, make easy for Muhammad the agony.'

And He has frequently mentioned the Earth in His Mighty Book so that one may contemplate its wonders, for its surface is a dwelling place for the living and its interior is a resting place for the dead. He, the Exalted, said: 'Have We not made the Earth a receptacle (Kifatan) for the living and the dead?' ğŸ“– Vol 1: Book of Knowledge
And what was narrated by Abdullah bin Muhammad al-Balawi: He said: I and Umar bin Nabatah were sitting discussing the worshippers and the ascetics (Zahid), and Umar said to me: I have not seen anyone more pious (Wara') nor more eloquent than Muhammad bin Idris al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him. I went out with him and al-Harith bin Labid to al-Safa, and al-Harith was a student of the righteous al-Mari, and he began to recite, and he had a beautiful voice, and he recited this verse to him: 'This is a day when they will not speak, nor will they be permitted to offer excuses' (al-Mursalat: 35 and 36). And I saw al-Shafi'i, may Allah have mercy on him, and his color had changed, and his skin had goosebumps, and he trembled a severe trembling, and he fell unconscious. When he regained consciousness, he began to say: 'I seek refuge in You from the station of the liars and the turning away of the heedless. O Allah, to You have submitted the hearts of the knowers (Arif), and to You have bowed the necks of the yearners (Mushtaq). My God, grant me Your generosity, and clothe me with Your covering, and forgive my shortcomings by the nobility of Your face.' He said: Then he walked and we departed.

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
And fruits from whatever they desire,
[Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
[O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
